vote.title: Resolution in Support of AB 1703 (Ramos), the California Indian Education Act to Encourage Ongoing Collaborative Relationships with Local Tribes to further Native American Student Achievement and Establish Positive and Inclusive Collaborative Relationships with District Native American Families
vote.description: Whereas, The Los Angeles Unified School District serves thousands of Native American students, and Los Angeles County has the highest number of Native Americans in the US. The District commits to working with Native and Indigenous community groups to develop better ways of counting and tracking Native and Indigenous students;Whereas, It is the goal of the District to ensure equity and outstanding achievement among all students and, commit to implementing AB 1703 once signed by Governor Newsom and create the task force of tribes, land-based tribes, Native and Indigenous organizations to implement it successfully;Whereas, The history and culture of California Indian instruction too frequently relies upon inaccurate, misleading, or incomplete educational materials; and has been traumatizing for Native and Indigenous students. We commit to working with local tribes like the Fernendeno Tataviam,Ventureno Chumash, and Gabrielino Tongva to develop an accurate curriculum on Native people that have been here for time immemorial and still thrive amongst us;Whereas, A more complete and accurate telling of the history of the state’s Native Americans, including age-appropriate chapters that include state financed efforts at genocide, and forced servitude would foster greater understanding of the forces and factors that shaped California history and a deeper understanding of the state’s Native American population;Whereas, California Native Americans also practiced wise land and water stewardship that are now highly regarded and researched and, California Indians have also demonstrated cultural contributions of song, dance, and artisanship in various mediums; and LAUSD commits to creating curriculum, spaces, and events that highlight these contributions;Whereas, Native American tribes reside within the geographic boundaries of our school district, and the District commits to partnering with Fernandeno Tataviam Band of Mission Indians’, CA State recognized Education Program for Indigenous Student Initiatives, including tribal consultation beyond federally recognized tribes, and expanding to the recommendation of Indigenous Education Now Coalition; Whereas, Local Native Americans would provide an invaluable source of information about the history and culture of their tribe that would benefit all students and add a long-silent voice in the telling of our region’s past, present, and future; and Whereas, In ensuring the equitable and positive future we all seek for our region, the voice of tribes, especially local land based (Federally and Non-Federally Recognized Tribes) California tribes is essential; now, therefore be it Resolved, That the Governing Board of the Los Angeles Unified School District value and support diversity and inclusion and recognize both the legal right to and the reciprocal benefits of inclusive education for the benefit of Native and Indigenous students in the District; Resolved further, That the Board support AB 1703 by California Assembly member James C. Ramos which would encourage collaboration with local Native American tribes and the assessment of Native American student achievement in the District; and the District commits to implementing before and upon the final signature by Governor Newsom; Resolved further, That the Board urges Governor Newsom to sign AB 1703; and, be it finally Resolved, That the Superintendent distribute copies of this resolution to all who shall require it for appropriate District implementation.
